intro: Leiotelis annua, commonly known as the annual leiotelis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
